title: Hawthorn Dene Walking Route

images.title: peter robinson / Hawthorn Dene footpath
images.caption: Footpath at the reserve. From the cliff top at Hawthorn Hive crossing the East Coast Railway and into Hawthorn Dene, County Durham.

images.title: Chris Heaton / Viaduct over Hawthorn Dene
images.caption: Viaduct over Hawthorn Dene. The County Durham Coastal Railway crosses the impressive magnesium limestone gorge of Hawthorn Dene between Peterlee and Seaham

images.title: Field on the north side of Hawthorn Dene by Robert Graham, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Field on the north side of Hawthorn Dene

images.title: Hawthorn Burn Viaduct by Mick Garratt, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Hawthorn Burn Viaduct

images.title: Chris Heaton / Hawthorn Quarry
images.caption: Hawthorn Quarry. Eastern entrance to this large quarry - magnesium limestone being the material that is scraped out of the ground. The quarry lies on the northern side of the reserve.

images.title: peter robinson / Hawthorn Dene, County Durham
images.caption: Summer buttercups in the rich magnesium limestone grassland.

images.title: peter robinson / Tree lined footpath
images.caption: Tree lined footpath. Leading from Hawthorn Village to the Durham County Coast

description: This delightful nature reserve near Easington has nice footpaths to follow. The paths will take you through attractive woodland and along the pretty Hawthorn Burn. The reserve is located just to the south of Seaham. You could follow the Durham Coastal Footpath to reach the site. Alternatively there is a car park just to the north of the reserve. From here you can pick up the footpaths east through the reserve to the coast. You'll pass the railway viaduct before coming to Hawthorn Hive, with cliffs and rocky shore. Look out for a variety of flora and fauna including snowdrops, wild garlic and bluebells in the spring. Notable wildlife includes jay, treecreeper, great spotted woodpecker and roe deer. If you would like to extend your walk you could follow the coast path south and visit the lovely Castle Eden Dene. Here you will find miles of woodland trails, pretty streams, rushing waterfalls and an abundance of wildlife in this splendid nature reserve in Peterlee.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head a few miles west and there's Hetton Lyons Country Park to explore. There's a fine lakeside cycling and walking trail here with good facilities including watersports and a cafe.

display_address: Hawthorn Dene Nature Reserve, Barn Hollows, South Farm, Hawthorn, County Durham, North East, England, SR7 8SJ, United Kingdom
